edu.teco.smartlambda.rest.controller

Class LambdaController

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.teco.smartlambda.rest.controller.LambdaController

  • public class LambdaController
extends Object
    Provides REST calls related to lifecycle handling of lambdas.

    • Method Detail

      • createLambda

        public static Object createLambda(spark.Request request,
                                  spark.Response response)
                           throws IOException
        PUT /:user/lambda/:name

        Creates a new lambda.

        The request must contain a new, unused lambda name. Responds with an empty JSON object on success.

        Body parameters
        Name Type Description Required
        async boolean Sets whether the lambda should be executed asynchronously per default default = false
        runtime enum("jre8") The runtime required for executing the lambda Yes
        src Base64-encoded byte stream Source code or binary container, depending on the runtime Yes
        Throws:
        NotAuthenticatedException - 401 Thrown when user is not properly authenticated
        InsufficientPermissionsException - 403 Thrown when the currently authenticated key is not permitted to create new lambdas
        UserNotFoundException - 404 Thrown when target lambda owner user is unknown
        RuntimeNotFoundException - 400 Thrown when specified runtime is unknown
        MissingSourceException - 400 Thrown when no source code or binary container was provided
        IOException

      • updateLambda

        public static Object updateLambda(spark.Request request,
                                  spark.Response response)
                           throws IOException
        PATCH /:user/lambda/:name

        Updates an existing lambda.

        The request must specify the name of an existing lambda. Responds with an empty JSON object on success.

        Body parameters
        Name Type Description Required
        async boolean Sets whether the lambda should be executed asynchronously per default No
        runtime enum("jre8") The runtime required for executing the lambda No
        src Base64-encoded byte stream Source code or binary container, depending on the runtime No
        Throws:
        NotAuthenticatedException - 401 Thrown when user is not properly authenticated
        InsufficientPermissionsException - 403 Thrown when the currently authenticated key is not permitted to modify the lambda
        UserNotFoundException - 404 Thrown when target lambda owner user is unknown
        LambdaNotFoundException - 404 Thrown when target lambda is unknown
        RuntimeNotFoundException - 400 Thrown when specified runtime is unknown
        MissingSourceException - 400 Thrown when source code or binary container is specified and not null but has zero length
        IOException

      • readLambda

        public static Object readLambda(spark.Request request,
                                spark.Response response)
                         throws IOException
        GET /:user/lambda/:name

        Reads metadata about an existing lambda.

        The request must specify the name of an existing lambda. No body parameters are required.

        Response values
        Name Type Description
        user string Name of the lambda owner
        name string Lambda name
        async boolean True, if the lambda is executed asynchronously per default, false otherwise.
        runtime enum("jre8") The runtime used for executing the lambda.
        Throws:
        NotAuthenticatedException - 401 Thrown when user is not properly authenticated
        InsufficientPermissionsException - 403 Thrown when the currently authenticated key is not permitted to read the requested lambda
        UserNotFoundException - 404 Thrown when target lambda owner user is unknown
        LambdaNotFoundException - 404 Thrown when target lambda is unknown
        IOException

      • deleteLambda

        public static Object deleteLambda(spark.Request request,
                                  spark.Response response)
        DELETE /:user/lambda/:name

        Deletes an existing lambda.

        The request must specify the name of an existing lambda. No body parameters are required. Responds with an empty JSON object on success.

        Throws:
        NotAuthenticatedException - 401 Thrown when user is not properly authenticated
        InsufficientPermissionsException - 403 Thrown when the currently authenticated key is nor permitted to delete the lambda
        UserNotFoundException - 404 Thrown when target lambda owner user is unknown
        LambdaNotFoundException - 404 Thrown when target lambda is unknown

      • executeLambda

        public static Object executeLambda(spark.Request request,
                                   spark.Response response)
                            throws IOException
        POST /:user/lambda/:name

        Executes a lambda.

        The request must specify the name of an existing lambda. The body contains the response generated by the lambda. Empty if no response is generated.

        Body parameters
        Name Type Description Required
        async boolean Whether to execute the lambda asynchronously default = default async value of lambda
        parameters object An arbitrary JSON object with parameters to pass to the lambda Yes
        Throws:
        NotAuthenticatedException - 401 Thrown when user is not properly authenticated
        InsufficientPermissionsException - 403 Thrown when the currently authenticated key is not permitted to execute the lambda
        UserNotFoundException - 404 Thrown when target lambda owner is unknown
        LambdaNotFoundException - 404 Thrown when target lambda is unknown
        IOException

      • getLambdaList

        public static Object getLambdaList(spark.Request request,
                                   spark.Response response)
        GET /:user/lambdas

        Gets a list of lambdas owned by the specified user that are visible to the authenticated user. No body parameters are required . The response contains an array of objects in the style of the table below. User must be authenticated with their primary key.

        Response object values
        Name Type Description
        user string Name of the lambda owner
        name string Lambda name
        async boolean True, if the lambda is executed asynchronously per default, false otherwise.
        runtime enum("jre8") The runtime used for executing the lambda.
        Throws:
        NotAuthenticatedException - 401 Thrown when user is not properly authenticated
        InsufficientPermissionsException - 403 Thrown when user is not authenticated with their primary key
        UserNotFoundException - 404 Thrown when target lambda owner user is unknown
        LambdaNotFoundException - 404 Thrown when target lambda is unknown

      • getStatistics

        public static Object getStatistics(spark.Request request,
                                   spark.Response response)
        GET /:user/lambda/:name/statistics

        Reads statistical information about past executions of the lambda. No body parameters are required.

        Response values
        Name Type Description
        executions integer Number of times the lambda was executed
        errors integer Number of times the lambda threw an error on execution
        averageExecutionTime float Average duration of past executions
        Throws:
        NotAuthenticatedException - 401 Thrown when user is not properly authenticated
        InsufficientPermissionsException - 403 Thrown when the currently authenticated key is not permitted to read statistics about the requested lambda
        UserNotFoundException - 404 Thrown when target lambda owner user is unknown
        LambdaNotFoundException - 404 Thrown when target lambda is unknown
